intro: Alectorolophus behrendsenii, commonly known as the red sandalwood, is a rare and endangered tree species native to the island of Socotra. It is characterized by its unique, woody, and aromatic leaves, which are often used in traditional medicine. The plant has a slow growth rate and is adapted to the arid and rocky environment of its native habitat. Its conservation status is critical due to overharvesting and habitat loss. Alectorolophus behrendsenii plays a significant ecological role in its ecosystem, supporting local biodiversity.
